3.title: Introduction
3.content: The oral care industry has seen a great increase in sales and revenue in recent years, owing to the increasing awareness among consumers. Consumers in developing countries have started adopting better oral health practices, contributing further to the oral care market. This market research project is a study of the interdental cleaning market. Specifically, the research focuses on Oral-B, a pioneer and leader within the industry. The project looks into Oral-B’s range of Interdental Brushes, specifically tailored for the Singapore market.

4.title: The Oral Care Market
4.content: The world oral care market in 2020 was valued at $53 billion USD, and is estimated to reach $96 billion by the year 2031. The Asia Pacific region is estimated to have the largest potential growth in the coming years where countries in the low-income bracket are shifting to the mid-income bracket and those in the mid-income bracket climbing into the high-income bracket.1 . The Asia Pacific region dominated the market in 2021 with a revenue share of over 40.0%.2 . As of 2020, tootbrushes account for $35,184.3 million in sales globally.

5.title: Interdental Brushes
5.content: When it comes to oral care, preventive measures play a key role in maintaining good dental health. This is where interdental brushes have emerged as a key player in order to prevent gum disease and tooth decay. The importance of interdental cleaning cannot be overstated. It serves as a crucial element in removing debris and plaque from the hard-to-reach spaces between teeth, mitigating the risk of oral health problems.

6.title: Oral-B
6.content: At the forefront of this dental revolution is Oral-B. Founded in 1950 in California USA, Oral-B has been the industry pioneer for toothbrush technology, electric toothbrushes and other oral hygiene products. Oral-B holds 9.7% of Brand market share worldwide as of 2022, which is the 2nd largest share after Colgate (14.9%)3. Oral-B and Crest are sister brands under the same corporate umbrella Procter & Gamble Co, and together they occupy 17.3% of the market share. Based on this we can infer that Oral-B is one of the largest players in the market worldwide. Oral-B also holds 17.7% of the market share in Singapore, making it the largest brand in Singapore.4 . When it comes to Oral-Care Appliances, Oral-B occupies a whopping 43.9% market share in Singapore, leading all competitors by a serious margin5. In the pages that follow, we will explore the intricate details of the market environment surrounding Oral-B, the innovations that have shaped its product portfolio, and the unique characteristics of interdental brushes that cater to the diverse needs of the Singaporean market. 8.title: Analysis of the Market for Interdental Toothbrushes
8.content: The market for interdental toothbrushes has exhibited significant growth, with a value of USD 267.55 million in 2023. Despite being a fraction of the overall oral care market, the interdental brush segment is poised for substantial expansion, with a projected Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of approximately 7.25% over the next decade. By 2032, the market is estimated to reach a value of USD 410.11 million.1 . This growth is driven by increasing awareness of oral health and the efficacy of interdental cleaning in preventing dental issues. The global interdental cleaning product market size was USD 2.57 Billion in 2022 and is expected to reach USD 4.27 Billion in 2032 .

9.title: Key Macro Environmental Factors
9.content: Sociocultural Factors . | Demographics emerge as a primary influencer in the interdental toothbrush market. | Consumers with higher education are more likely to invest in interdental brushes, driven by a heightened awareness of oral health issues. | Additionally, an aging population both globally and in Singapore contributes to the rising demand for effective oral care solutions. | The ease of use and effectiveness of interdental toothbrushes position them as an ideal solution for both younger and older demographics facing dental problems. | . Economic Factors . | Consumers in this region have higher disposable income which increases the likelihood of adoption | . Political Factors . | Singapore government initiatives such as the Zero Waste Masterplan are political considerations for Interdental Products. Getting businesses on board to support Singapore’s drive to reduce waste and operate sustainably is best done by an organisation that understands their needs and constraints. Since 2001, this role has been played by the Waste Management and Recycling Association of Singapore (WMRAS) – the national trade body for local waste disposal and resource recovery companies. | While compliance with sustainability policies might be a challenge, it also presesnts opportunities to lead the market in environment-friendly products | Interdental brushes have reusable components which can be leveraged in this regard | . Legal Factors . | There is a considerable amount of legislation and regulation regarding health care products including specific regulation for dental products | The Health Products (Oral Dental Gums) Regulations 2016 which is part of the Health Products Act provides a set of guidelines for this market | This includes regulation for Product Presentation and Advertisement, which will be key considerations when promoting products | .

10.title: Customer Segments and Target Customers
10.content: The target customer base for interdental toothbrushes is diverse, encompassing individuals aged 12 and above as recommended by healthcare professionals. Younger demographics, as well as older individuals with specific oral care needs, form a significant portion of the target market. With versatility in usage and a recommendation from the healthcare industry, the target customer range is extensive, spanning various demographics and lifestyles.

13.content: Current usage: . | Oral-B’s interdental brush deep cleaning bristles helps to remove food and plaque from hard to reach places where your brushes cannot reach | . | On the market currently, there are two types of interdental brush. The normal size which is smaller than a toothbrush for convenient use. Another design comes with a brush handle with a replaceable interdental brush head that replicates the conventional toothbrush. | . Critique and improvements: . Oral-B’s interdental brush has managed to target the needs of both younger and older demographic, on the importance of dental health. However based on the reviews on their website, many are complaining about the quality of product, claiming that it damages quickly and non-reusable .

21.title: Executive Summary
21.content: This marketing plan outlines strategies to enhance the market position of Oral-B’s interdental brushes in the Singapore market. Through improved product quality, targeted promotions, and sustainability initiatives, Oral-B aims to increase market share, drive sales, and foster brand loyalty among consumers.

22.title: Introduction
22.content: Oral-B, a subsidiary of Procter & Gamble Co., has been a pioneer in oral care since its founding in 1950. With a global presence and a reputation for innovation, Oral-B holds a significant market share in the oral care industry, including the interdental brush segment. This plan focuses on optimizing Oral-B’s marketing approach for interdental brushes in Singapore.

23.title: Target Market:
23.content: Oral-B’s target market for interdental brushes in Singapore comprises individuals aged 12 and above, with a focus on those who prioritize oral health and are willing to invest in preventive care products. This includes consumers with higher disposable incomes, urban dwellers, and those who are educated about the importance of interdental cleaning. The target market selection is based on demographic trends, consumer behavior analysis, and market research indicating a growing demand for oral care solutions in Singapore.

24.title: SWOT Analysis
24.content: Strengths . | Established brand reputation and trust. | Wide product range catering to various consumer needs. | Strong distribution network. Weaknesses . | Quality concerns regarding product durability. | Limited online presence for interdental brushes. Opportunities . | According to online consumer feedback on quality issues, we recommend Oral-B need to choose more robust and degradable materials. | Growing demand for oral care products in Singapore. | Increasing awareness of oral health among consumers. Threats . | Intense competition from rival brands like Colgate and TePe. | Environmental concerns related to plastic waste. Objectives: | .

25.title: Organizational Objectives
25.content: . | To maintain leadership in the oral care market and drive sustainable growth. | .

26.title: Marketing Objectives:
26.content: . | Increase market share for Oral-B interdental brushes by 15% within the next two years in Singapore. | Achieve a customer satisfaction rate of 90% through improved product quality and customer service. | Increase brand awareness and customer engagement by 20% through targeted marketing campaigns and promotions. | .

27.title: Strategy
27.content: 1. Increase Market Share: . | Improve Product Quality: Address customer complaints about product durability by enhancing the materials and construction of interdental brushes. Conduct regular quality testing to ensure consistency. | Expand Distribution Channels: Partner with additional retailers and online platforms to increase availability and reach a wider customer base. Consider exclusive partnerships to differentiate Oral-B’s products from competitors. | Competitive Pricing Strategy: Evaluate pricing to maintain competitiveness while reflecting the improved product quality. Offer bundle deals or discounts to encourage bulk purchases. | . 2. Achieve Customer Satisfaction: . | Enhance Product Education: Provide detailed instructions on proper usage and care of interdental brushes through packaging inserts, online resources, and customer support channels. Educate consumers about the benefits of interdental cleaning for oral health. | Customer Feedback Mechanism: Implement a system for collecting and addressing customer feedback promptly. Use feedback to identify areas for improvement and make necessary adjustments to products and services. | Expedited Customer Service: Offer responsive customer support through multiple channels, including phone, email, and social media. Ensure timely resolution of inquiries and complaints to enhance overall satisfaction. | . 3. Increase Brand Awareness and Engagement: . | Targeted Marketing Campaigns: Develop marketing campaigns tailored to the Singaporean market, emphasizing the unique benefits of Oral-B’s interdental brushes. Utilize digital advertising, social media, and influencer partnerships to reach target demographics. | Promotional Events: Host events or participate in community outreach programs focused on oral health awareness. Offer free samples or demonstrations of interdental brushes to engage with consumers directly. | Loyalty Programs: Implement a loyalty program to reward repeat purchases and encourage brand loyalty. Offer exclusive discounts, rewards, or access to special events for program members. | . 4. Enhance Sustainability Initiatives: . | Recycle and Trade-In Program: Launch a recycling program for used interdental brushes, offering incentives such as discounts on future purchases for customers who return their old brushes for recycling. Partner with recycling facilities to ensure proper disposal and reuse of materials. | Eco-Friendly Packaging: Transition to eco-friendly packaging materials that are recyclable or biodegradable. Clearly communicate the company’s commitment to sustainability on product packaging and marketing materials. | Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) Initiatives: Support environmental conservation efforts and community initiatives related to oral health education. Engage employees and consumers in volunteer activities or fundraising campaigns to demonstrate Oral-B’s dedication to social responsibility. | .

28.title: Sustainability and Ethics Considerations
28.content: These are the major issues which we identified to be of the highest important to this product and the company: . | Impact on the environment | Oral health research and Customer awareness | .

29.title: Impact on the Environment
29.content: Plastic waste arising from the use of disposable dentistry and oral care products presents a major environmental concern. The impact of these products is greater than other daily use plastic products because most of the waste comes from long-lasting materials being used for short-lived applications such as disposable tools and packaging materials. Possible improvements . A solution we can consider is to combine purchasing the product with recycling the interdental brushes. This can be done through providing incentives to customers for recycling. Consumers will receive a trade-in service after purchasing interdental brushes. When this product is at the end of its life cycle, consumers can replace it through the official website or the channel where they originally purchased it. The company will reduce a part of the price of the new interdental brush through the recycling of the old brush. To reduce the use of long-lasting materials, the company can use degradable materials that are easier to recycle to make brushes. In this way, consumers can keep using our products.

30.title: Oral Health Research and Customer Awareness
30.content: Oral-health literacy is an ethical consideration for Oral-B. It is in Oral-B’s best interests to fund oral-health research and make the findings available to the public. This may seem harmful to the company as competitors will also benefit from such research. But from an ethical perspective, this benefits the society which sustains the company and has the potential to benefit Oral-B. An educated target market means consumers are better equipped to make informed decisions about their oral health, including selecting products that best meet their needs. By funding oral-health research and disseminating findings, Oral-B empowers consumers with knowledge, fostering trust and loyalty. This not only enhances Oral-B’s reputation as a socially responsible company but also strengthens its long-term relationships with consumers. Additionally, a more knowledgeable population can lead to improved overall oral health outcomes, which ultimately benefits society as a whole, aligning with Oral-B’s ethical responsibilities to contribute positively to the well-being of the communities it serves. Thus, investing in oral-health literacy ultimately serves Oral-B’s interests by creating a more engaged and informed consumer base while simultaneously fulfilling its ethical obligations to promote public health.
